next up we have carol and therese from
the 2015 romantic drama carol directed
by todd haynes and written by phyllis
nagy the screenplay was based on the
1952 novel the price of salt by patricia
highsmith which was republished and
retitled as carol in 1990. the price of
salt was semi-autobiographical with
highsmith basing the character therese
on herself and taking inspiration from
her time working as a sales clerk in the
toy section of bloomingdale's in 1948.
she described one specific interaction
with an elegant blonde woman in a mink
coat who left such an impression on her
that she went home that night and
outlined a book in two hours realising
the next day that she'd been under the
influence of chickenpox that outline
morphed into the story of a forbidden
romance between nineteen-year-old
therese bellave and carol aird an
upperclass wife and mother in her
thirties the price of salt became the
first ever lesbian novel to have a happy
ending and was highsmith's only novel
about an unambiguous lesbian
relationship despite the author being
openly gay
screenwriter phyllis nagy befriended
smith while on assignment for the new
york times back in the late 80s and the
two remained close until highsmith's
passing in 1995. nagi had felt a
responsibility to ensure that the screen
adaptation of carol would stay true to
the source material and spent nearly two
decades trying to get it made several
investors actors and directors came and
went feeling that the script was too
risky because it featured a gay theme
and two female leads ah

adapted from a 1997 short story
brokeback mountain is a romance drama
directed by ang lee and written by larry
mcmurty and diana asana it's the tale of
a rodeo cowboy named jack twist played
by jake gyllenhaal and ranch hand named
ennis del mar played by the late heath
ledger the two men are hired as sheep
herders in wyoming and one night as
they're camping on brokeback mountain
jack makes a drunken pass on ennis who
reciprocates and the two men develop a
love affair that lasts two decades ennis
ends up marrying his longtime sweetheart
alma and jack marries a fellow rodeo
rider named laureen but the two men
maintain their relationship while
attempting to hide its true nature even
in the beginning ennis was far more
reluctant to show affection than jack
and there's good reason for that when
ennis was a young boy his father made it
clear that being gay was not an option
and even showed him the body of a man
who was tortured and killed for
suspected homosexuality but jack was
quicker to embrace his true feelings and
often spoke of creating an honest future
with ennis living on a ranch in peace
unfortunately the two never make it
there
